text:
Grand Street, south side, at Essex Street. Also shown is Essex Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Grand Street.

October 28, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

56-76 Essex Street, east side, from Grand to Broome Streets. The second house from the right is a three-story frame with a stucco front.

June 16, 1928.

P.L. Sperr

Grand Street, north side, west from, but not including Essex Street, showing the former site of P.S. No. 137 (clearance in foreground). Also shown are Nos. 65 to 73 Ludlow Street, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Grand Street. The 4-story house at the corner faces on Grand Street and bears No. 334.

April 4, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Essex Street, east side, north from Grand Street.
February 14, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.

Essex Street, north from and including Grand Street.

February 14, 1930.

P.L. Sperr.

348 Grand Street, north side, between Essex and Ludlow Streets, showing P.S. 137 or the Seward Park High School, of Manhattan.

Board of Education, N.Y.C.

1920.
1930.

(1)
Grand Street, north side, west from Essex, to and including Ludlow Streets. The view shows Seward Park High School.
April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at an earlier date, and showing demolition of the former Public School No. 137 on this site.
